The lease-to-own structure reveals the real strategy. xAI raised $22B total (per Jarsy‚Äôs research) and hit $3.2B ARR in 7 months‚Äîbut that growth requires compute at scale that doesn‚Äôt exist yet. By securing GPUs via lease + building dedicated power, they‚Äôre solving for: (1) Nvidia‚Äôs allocation bottlenecks, (2) cloud provider markup (CoreWeave hit $2B doing nothing but GPU hosting), (3) inference cost structure as Grok scales across X‚Äôs 550M+ MAU. This isn‚Äôt just scaling‚Äîit‚Äôs owning the entire value chain from electrons to tokens.

Cathie Wood and Tom Lee nailed it. 

Ethereum $ETH is the monetary base & the more the ecosystem builds on top the more valuable the base layer becomes.

$NVDA just put out a new post on data centers & energy storage. 

They‚Äôre calling long duration battery systems essential for managing AI power swings. 

That‚Äôs exactly where $EOSE fits in.

Rumors are $INTC just locked in a major AI customer for its 18A process with signs that more are lining up. 

The foundry comeback is starting to look real.

$AMZN AWS, $MSFT Azure & $GOOGL cloud have already won scale but $ORCL is winning speed.

The real takeaway is Oracle carving out a lane where AI infrastructure meets traditional enterprise demand.

The Fear and Greed Index is sitting at extreme fear and the VIX is at 25 while $SPY & $QQQ are still less than 3% from all time highs.

The data and the mood are telling two very different stories.
Me with $AMZN & $MELI when everyone‚Äôs selling

$ORCL just guided to $166B in cloud infra revenue by FY2030 after AI infra grew 117% YoY last quarter.

Oracle said AI margins are at 35% versus reports calling for 15%. That margin spread shows Oracle‚Äôs AI biz is already scaling faster & more profitably than most expected.

xAI is reportedly securing a $20B lease-to-own deal for $NVDA GPUs to lock in long-term inference capacity.

It‚Äôs also forming a joint venture with Solaris Energy to build a 1-gigawatt power plant to feed it.

Goldman Sachs predicts hyperscaler capex will reach $1.4 trillion cumulatively from 2025 through 2027, predicting spending of $471 billion next year before rising to $543 billion in 2027.

Oracle $ORCL says that Oracle Cloud Infrastructure is now on track for $166 billion in revenue by fiscal 2030, up more than 15% from its prior forecast from Q1 for $144 billion.

Global data center power capacity is projected to more than triple through 2035, rising from 81GW in 2024 to 277GW by 2035, per BloombergNEF‚Äôs New Energy Outlook.

$MSFT $AMZN $GOOG $META $NVDA

TSMC $TSM raised its 2025 revenue guide to mid-30% growth from close to 30% growth last quarter on the back of ‚Äòvery strong‚Äô AI demand, while also seeing Q4 revenue of $32.2-33.4B, up 22% YoY at midpoint. 

$NVDA $AMD $AVGO $AAPL

TSMC Q3 revenue grew by 40.8% YoY and 10.1% QoQ to $33.10 billion, beating the guidance midpoint by 2.2% on strong AI demand.

GAAP EPS grew by 50.5% YoY to $2.92, beating the estimates by 12.3%.

Management raised full-year revenue guidance from 30% growth to the mid-30s, driven by robust AI-related demand.

$TSM $NVDA $AVGO $AAPL

Amazon $AMZN, Microsoft $MSFT, Meta $META and Google $GOOG have nearly 12GW of data center capacity currently operational, and another 26.2GW under development, according to BloombergNEF. 

The four account for approximately 42% of US data center capacity.
